intro: Pavetta elliottii var. elliottii, commonly known as Elliott's pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many tropical and subtropical species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and along stream banks. It produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in umbels. The leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a glossy surface, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
